subject: RE: [junit] Why no assertNotEquals()?
msgSnippet: ... Hmm... maybe you wanted something like GSBase s EqualsTester, instead. Tests that use assertEquals() must assume that equals() works. If you want to test
messageBody:
>So said Michael Orozco on 2003-06-24 --------------------
>Good Question!
>
>I have always wondered about that. Having quite figured it out on the
>assertEquals, but on the assertTrue I us something like this this:
>
>assertTrue(!image.isChild());
>
>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
>
>Robert DiFalco <rdifalco@...> wrote:
>Yeah, it is a little odd. We have an AbstractTestCase and we just added
>the two version of #assertNotEquals there. We also added an
>#assertEqualsSameHash which makes sure that if two objects are equal,
>that their hashes are also equal.

Hmm... maybe you wanted something like GSBase's EqualsTester, instead. Tests that use assertEquals() must assume that equals() works. If you want to test equals(), that ought to be done separately. You have some subtle test coupling there that could lead you to forget that equals()/hashCode() *may not* work.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
